laws.summary: Non-competes SEVERELY RESTRICTED - disfavored by courts
requirements: Non-competes SEVERELY RESTRICTED - disfavored by courts

Minnesota strongly disfavors non-competes. Only enforceable to protect trade secrets or when employer provides extraordinary training. Cannot restrict ordinary competitive activity. Blue-pencil doctrine does NOT apply.
Best practice: Use confidentiality and trade secret protection only
Action required: Remove non-compete OR limit strictly to trade secret protection
laws.notes: Minnesota strongly disfavors non-competes. Only enforceable to protect trade secrets or when employer provides extraordinary training. Cannot restrict ordinary competitive activity. Blue-pencil doctrine does NOT apply.

requirements: Cannot consider arrests without convictions
Employers cannot consider arrest records that did not result in conviction. Ban-the-box applies to government employers and some private employers.
Action required: Review background check policies for compliance
Do not consider arrests without convictions
laws.notes: Employers cannot consider arrest records that did not result in conviction. Ban-the-box applies to government employers and some private employers.

laws.summary: Minnesota minimum wage: $10.85/hour large employers, $8.85 small employers (2024)
requirements: Minnesota minimum wage: $10.85/hour large employers, $8.85 small employers (2024)
Large employers (annual gross revenue $500k+): $10.85/hour. Small employers (under $500k): $8.85/hour. Indexed for inflation annually.
Action required: Ensure compliance with size-based minimum
Must pay applicable Minnesota minimum wage
laws.notes: Large employers (annual gross revenue $500k+): $10.85/hour. Small employers (under $500k): $8.85/hour. Indexed for inflation annually.

laws.summary: EARNED SICK AND SAFE TIME REQUIRED (effective January 1, 2024)
laws.statute_citation: Minnesota Earned Sick and Safe Time (ESST) Law
requirements: EARNED SICK AND SAFE TIME REQUIRED (effective January 1, 2024)
All employees accrue 1 hour per 30 hours worked, up to 48 hours per year. Can be used for illness, injury, health care, safety reasons.
Action required: Implement ESST policy and tracking
Provide 1 hour per 30 hours worked
laws.notes: All employees accrue 1 hour per 30 hours worked, up to 48 hours per year. Can be used for illness, injury, health care, safety reasons.

requirements: At-will employment applies
Arbitration enforceable

laws.summary: Drug testing REGULATED - specific procedures required
requirements: Drug testing REGULATED - specific procedures required
Minnesota Drug and Alcohol Testing in the Workplace Act requires written policy, specific procedures, confirmatory testing, and employee rights protections.
Action required: Ensure drug testing policy complies with Minnesota requirements
Follow statutory testing procedures
laws.notes: Minnesota Drug and Alcohol Testing in the Workplace Act requires written policy, specific procedures, confirmatory testing, and employee rights protections.

laws.summary: Final wages due within 24 hours if terminated, next payday if quit
requirements: Final wages due within 24 hours if terminated, next payday if quit
Discharged employees: pay within 24 hours. Resigned employees: next regular payday (or within 20 days if no regular payday).
Action required: Ensure immediate payment capability for terminations
Pay within 24 hours if terminated
laws.notes: Discharged employees: pay within 24 hours. Resigned employees: next regular payday (or within 20 days if no regular payday).

requirements: Meal and rest breaks REQUIRED
Rest break: Paid 15-minute break for every 4 hours worked. Meal break: 20-minute unpaid break for 8-hour shift (must be provided within first 5 hours for 8+ hour shift).
Action required: Implement break policies complying with Minnesota law
Provide rest and meal breaks per statute
laws.notes: Rest break: Paid 15-minute break for every 4 hours worked. Meal break: 20-minute unpaid break for 8-hour shift (must be provided within first 5 hours for 8+ hour shift).
